text: Anyway, I've had a few new moms reach out to me recently asking how I manage to work from home, and part of the answer is I have three kids, they are all walking and mostly talking, and they play together nicely. These are some of the tools for the playing alone aspect.
author: bethanyshondark

text: It has also helped a lot that we took away almost all of their toys and put them in the basement. The only permanent toys upstairs are the crayons and Magnatiles. Everything else comes upstairs and then goes downstairs at the end of the day. But they're pretty occupied without.
author: bethanyshondark

text: We got those two months ago and they're still going strong. Each kid has their own box, labeled with their name, and they are responsible for their crayons. It's helped a lot with having them break and be all over. Easy to clean off surfaces, etc.
author: bethanyshondark

text: We also listen to the Toddler Radio station on Pandora. Our @Sonos speaker is on all day, every day. It's how we finally broke the TV habit.  (thanks to the podcasts, music and books). We also invested in these amazing crayons that I super recommend: https://amzn.to/2uiEVX4
author: bethanyshondark

text: We listen to a LOT of podcasts, mostly @wowintheworld @storypirates and @ComeCircleRound. After we read a chapter book together I'll add it to the @Audible rotation. We've been going through a box set of Roald Dahl (yes I know he was an anti-Semite who wasn't) we got at Costco.
author: bethanyshondark

author: bethanyshondark

text: I’ve been thinking about starting a homeschool consulting business.
author: bethanyshondark

text: Thanks for keeping me company lol
author: bethanyshondark

text: Ok guys I’m happy to report I slept for 90 whole minutes, ate an entire banana and took more than a sip of water. First time in 20 hours. I’m gonna beat this.
author: bethanyshondark

text: I’ve followed @jonostrower for a decade. His coverage of Boeing over the years made me immediately suspect something of this nature may have happened. I can not recommend following him or his publication @theaircurrent more strongly as this story progresses.
author: bethanyshondark

text: Cherry on top of my son’s birthday appears to be a family-wide stomach bug.
author: bethanyshondark

text: Or someone else wrote it
author: bethanyshondark

author: bethanyshondark

text: Also what do I do with the buttermilk to make it non-dairy? We have coconut milk handy.
author: bethanyshondark

text: I think I’m going to make this recipe into a bundt cake.  How much time should I bake it do you think? @smittenkitchen
author: bethanyshondark

text: Spotted at the Purim carnival cc @unorthodox_pod @liel @stuffism
author: bethanyshondark

text: I call him the peanut butter in my peanut butter sandwich.
author: bethanyshondark

text: My goal for my son’s birthday was to call him only by his own name, not one of his siblings’, for one whole day.    I made it to 8:46am.
author: bethanyshondark

text: I was afraid I wouldn’t bond with him as easily. I only knew the mother-daughter relationship. So he came rocketing out (he was almost a car baby too) on my mom’s most favorite day.
author: bethanyshondark

text: He cuddles. He wrestles. He makes me laugh with just a funny face. I feel like I’m back in middle school with a crush. I crush on this boy all day, every day. Sometimes he throws me a bone of affection and it melts me into a puddle.
author: bethanyshondark

text: I grew up the only child of a single mom. Boys were a mystery. Raising a boy absolutely terrified me. How silly I find that now. How absolutely incredible it is.
author: bethanyshondark

text: Four years ago today I became the most wonderful thing in this world: a boy mom.
author: bethanyshondark

text: @AmySpiro @LahavHarkov hit me with your best pareve chocolate cake recipe for my son’s birthday tonight
author: bethanyshondark

text: Had a dream I discovered @KatiePavlich ‘s deep dark secret. She’s wasn’t from Arizona.... she was from... Queens. The cowboy boots were just an act.
author: bethanyshondark

text: We used to have @WarbyParker. I got a pair from them and they’ve withstood A LOT of abuse from my sons. My much more expensive Costco pair didn’t.
author: bethanyshondark

text: I would not know the size and scope of the disaster in Nebraska were it not for @BenSasse ‘s Twitter. What a horror. Praying for my fellow Americans.
author: bethanyshondark

text: I know everyone is RTing this with their stories of when they were 16 but there isn’t a chance in hell I’m doing the same. I survived.
author: bethanyshondark

text: I feel badly for every other kid mentioned in this story except these girls. Olivia skipped the first week of classes to go to Fiji.
author: bethanyshondark
